snippet: In the relative lull of a cease-fire, separatist leaders have set about building neo-Soviet states like those created in other pro-Russian enclaves.
abstract: Rebel leaders in separatist mini-states of Donetsk and Luhansk in eastern Ukraine have busily set about building the sort of neo-Soviet states that have cropped up in other pro-Russian enclaves in the former Soviet Union; such Soviet nostalgia may seem farcical to Westerners, but it has been well received by citizenry in pro-Russian enclaves.
lead_paragraph: In the relative lull of a cease-fire, separatist leaders have set about building neo-Soviet states like those created in other pro-Russian enclaves.

headline.main: Rebels in Eastern Ukraine Dream of Reviving Soviet Heyday
headline.print_headline: Rebels in Eastern Ukraine Dream of Reviving Soviet Heyday

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
